result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

treatment letter dated 09-01-2022;  filed under seal by Atty. Justin G Griffis
Hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:37 AM File not called on the record.
Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Maxwell A Colletti in court by zoom with attorney Justin G Griffis. 
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Griffis requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 8:30 AM 
Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Maxwell A Colletti in court with attorney Justin G Griffis. 
State files an Information.
Defense acknowledge receipt of the Information, waives its reading, and enters a not guilty plea.
Defense requests a another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:09 AM Defendant Maxwell A Colletti in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Police Department Officer Paxton Bergin sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Wittchow.  Cross examination by Attorney Griffis.  Attorney Griffis would like to call Victim A to the stand as a witness.  Attorney Wittchow objects to Victim A testifying in this matter.  The Court will allow for Victim A to testify under Marsy's Law.  Victim A is sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Griffis.  Cross examination by Attorney Wittchow.  Redirect by Attorney Griffis.  State rests.  State moves for bind over with argument.  Attorney Griffis objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  The State to file an information.  Attorney Wittchow is asking for an arraignment date to allow the State time to speak with Victim A.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment before the Trial Court.  Arraignment scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Justin Griffis
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 02/10/2022: Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

10:44 AM Defendant Maxwell A Colletti in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared in court.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.

The Court notes that the Victim A requests to modify bail to no VIOLENT contact.
The State has seen the letter and filed a letter notating as much.
The State does not object to Victim A's request.
The Court will modify bail to have NO VIOLENT CONTACT.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim time limits.
The Defendant wishes to waive the time limits associated with the prelim hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement.
DA filed letter, Victim wishes to have NO CONTACT AMENDED TO NO VIOLENT CONTACT. Sent to CC Herring to review. Court's response: Will address at next hearing (2/10/22)
Victim A request to modify bond conditions, dated 02-04-2022;  filed by the State
Motion and (proposed) Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement;  filed by the State

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:00 PM Defendant Maxwell A Colletti in court by phone, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luis Gutierrez appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and victim key and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
